intro: Nuttallia grandiflora, commonly known as the large-flowered nuttallia, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It is a member of the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its aromatic foliage. The plant produces showy white to pale yellow flowers that bloom in umbrella-like clusters, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Its leaves are finely divided and have a distinctive, slightly hairy texture. Nuttallia grandiflora typically grows in moist, well-drained soils in woodland or swampy areas.
